title: SLOW COOKER POT ROAST
directions: Season the chuck roast with the Kosher salt, pepper, and thyme (if you are sensitive to sodium, adjust to your taste or you can even leave the salt out altogether since you're adding broth).
Heat a cast iron pan. Add oil. Wait until it ripples, then deeply brown the roast for 4-5 minutes on each side.
In your slow cooker add the carrots, potatoes and garlic.
Lay the beef on top, then add the beef broth and cover, cooking on low for 8-10 hours or on high for 5-6 hours.
In the last hour, mix cornstarch and water and add it to the slow cooker to thicken the sauce, making a gravy.
Serve with gravy poured over the meat and garnished with parsley if desired.
ingredients: 1 pound carrots peeled and cut into 2" chunks
2 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes peeled and cut into large chunks
